item.title: Introduction
item.description: Mindmap of the book contents. Cross-links between chapters have been indicated as thin lines.

item.title: Visual motion processing and human tracking behavior
Biologically Inspired Dynamic Textures for Probing Motion Perception
Advances in Texture Analysis for Emphysema Classification
Dynamical Neural Networks: modeling low-level vision at short latencies
item.description: Dynamical Neural Networks (DyNNs) are a class of models for networks of neurons where particular focus is put on the role of time in the emergence of functional computational properties. The definition and study of these models involves the cooperation of a large range of scientific fields from statistical physics, probabilistic modelling, neuroscience and psychology to control theory. It focuses on the mechanisms that may be relevant for studying cognition by hypothesizing that information is distributed in the activity of the neurons in the system and that the timing helps in maintaining this information to lastly form decisions or actions.

item.title: Efficient Source Detection Using Integrate-and-Fire Neurons
